thread.title: Portions of I-5 will close Friday, Saturday nights
thread.title_full: Portions of I-5 will close Friday, Saturday nights | OregonLive.com

author: Tony Hernandez | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Portions of I-5 will close Friday, Saturday nights
text:
Construction crews will be closing parts of Interstate 5 on Friday and Saturday nights while they work to replace signs and paint new stripes on the road, according to the state Department of Transportation.
Starting at 10 p.m. Friday, portions of southbound I-5 at the Fremont Bridge will close to allow crews to apply deck seal. The southbound on-ramp from the Moda Center will stay open until 11 p.m. The exit to eastbound Interstate 84 will stay open, according to the press release. The highway is expected to re-open by 10 a.m. on Saturday.
At 10 p.m. Saturday, the same southbound I-5 section will close and re-open at 11 a.m. Sunday. The on-ramp from the Moda Center will remain open until midnight.
Further south, interstate on-ramps and the two lanes will be intermittently closed as crews paint stripes on the road between the Marquam Bridge and exit 294. Those closures will happen from 10 p.m. Friday to 10 a.m. Saturday, then again at 10 p.m. Saturday to 10 a.m. Sunday.
The work is part of the I-5 Sign Replacement and Paving Project which will swap more than 300 green freeway signs from Southwest Corbett Avenue to North Lombard Street while also repaving seven miles of the interste between Southwest Capitol Highway and the Marquam Bridge.
-- Tony Hernandez
thernandez@oregonian.com
